terms.definition: A form of professional writing that communicates complex technical information in a clear, concise, and easily understandable manner for specific audiences.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Subject Matter Expert - a person with specialized knowledge or expertise in a particular area or topic who provides technical input for documentation.
The process of managing documents from creation through publication, including version control, revision tracking, and workflow management.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple people to collaborate and maintain revision history.
A branch of artificial intelligence that helps computers understand, interpret, and generate human language in a meaningful way.
Contextual assistance and documentation integrated directly within software applications to provide users with real-time support.
Technical documentation that explains how to use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface, including endpoints, parameters, and examples.
A document that provides instructions and guidance on how to use a product, software, or system effectively.
Quality Assurance - the process of ensuring that documentation meets established standards for accuracy, consistency, and adherence to guidelines.
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as developers, designers, and writers collaborating on documentation.
The automated or AI-assisted process of creating written content based on input parameters, templates, or learned patterns.
The capability to create, manage, and display documentation in multiple languages to serve diverse global audiences.
Data-driven information about how users interact with documentation, including usage patterns, engagement metrics, and performance indicators.
Interactive guided experiences that walk users through key features and functionalities of software applications to improve onboarding and adoption.
